lines.text: Enter the PRINCESS of France, ROSALINE, MARIA, KATHARINE, BOYET, Lords, and other Attendants

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Now, madam, summon up your dearest spirits: Consider who the king your father sends, To whom he sends, and whats his embassy: Yourself, held precious in the worlds esteem, To parley with the sole inheritor Of all perfections that a man may owe, Matchless Navarre the plea of no less weight Than Aquitaine, a dowry for a queen. Be now as prodigal of all dear grace As Nature was in making graces dear When she did starve the general world beside And prodigally gave them all to you.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Good Lord Boyet, my beauty, though but mean, Needs not the painted flourish of your praise: Beauty is bought by judgement of the eye, Not utterd by base sale of chapmens tongues: I am less proud to hear you tell my worth Than you much willing to be counted wise In spending your wit in the praise of mine. But now to task the tasker: good Boyet, You are not ignorant, alltelling fame Doth noise abroad, Navarre hath made a vow, Till painful study shall outwear three years, No woman may approach his silent court: Therefore tos seemeth it a needful course, Before we enter his forbidden gates, To know his pleasure and in that behalf, Bold of your worthiness, we single you As our bestmoving fair solicitor. Tell him, the daughter of the King of France, On serious business, craving quick dispatch, Importunes personal conference with his grace: Haste, signify so much while we attend, Like humblevisaged suitors, his high will.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Proud of employment, willingly I go.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: All pride is willing pride, and yours is so. Who are the votaries, my loving lords, That are vowfellows with this virtuous duke
Exit BOYET

lines.speaker: first lord
lines.text: Lord Longaville is one.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Know you the man

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: I know him, madam: at a marriagefeast, Between Lord Perigort and the beauteous heir Of Jaques Falconbridge, solemnized In Normandy, saw I this Longaville: A man of sovereign parts he is esteemd Well fitted in arts, glorious in arms: Nothing becomes him ill that he would well. The only soil of his fair virtues gloss, If virtues gloss will stain with any soil, Is a sharp wit matched with too blunt a will Whose edge hath power to cut, whose will still wills It should none spare that come within his power.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Some merry mocking lord, belike ist so

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: They say so most that most his humours know.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Such shortlived wits do wither as they grow. Who are the rest

lines.speaker: katharine
lines.text: The young Dumain, a wellaccomplished youth, Of all that virtue love for virtue loved: Most power to do most harm, least knowing ill For he hath wit to make an ill shape good, And shape to win grace though he had no wit. I saw him at the Duke Alencons once And much too little of that good I saw Is my report to his great worthiness.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Another of these students at that time Was there with him, if I have heard a truth. Biron they call him but a merrier man, Within the limit of becoming mirth, I never spent an hours talk withal: His eye begets occasion for his wit For every object that the one doth catch The other turns to a mirthmoving jest, Which his fair tongue, conceits expositor, Delivers in such apt and gracious words That aged ears play truant at his tales And younger hearings are quite ravished So sweet and voluble is his discourse.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: God bless my ladies! are they all in love, That every one her own hath garnished With such bedecking ornaments of praise

lines.speaker: first lord
lines.text: Here comes Boyet.
Reenter BOYET

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Now, what admittance, lord

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Navarre had notice of your fair approach And he and his competitors in oath Were all addressd to meet you, gentle lady, Before I came. Marry, thus much I have learnt: He rather means to lodge you in the field, Like one that comes here to besiege his court, Than seek a dispensation for his oath, To let you enter his unpeopled house. Here comes Navarre.
Enter FERDINAND, LONGAVILLE, DUMAIN, BIRON, and Attendants

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Fair princess, welcome to the court of Navarre.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Fair I give you back again and welcome I have not yet: the roof of this court is too high to be yours and welcome to the wide fields too base to be mine.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: You shall be welcome, madam, to my court.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: I will be welcome, then: conduct me thither.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Hear me, dear lady I have sworn an oath.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Our Lady help my lord! hell be forsworn.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Not for the world, fair madam, by my will.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Why, will shall break it will and nothing else.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Your ladyship is ignorant what it is.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Were my lord so, his ignorance were wise, Where now his knowledge must prove ignorance. I hear your grace hath sworn out housekeeping: Tis deadly sin to keep that oath, my lord, And sin to break it. But pardon me. I am too suddenbold: To teach a teacher ill beseemeth me. Vouchsafe to read the purpose of my coming, And suddenly resolve me in my suit.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Madam, I will, if suddenly I may.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: You will the sooner, that I were away For youll prove perjured if you make me stay.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Did not I dance with you in Brabant once

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Did not I dance with you in Brabant once

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: I know you did.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: How needless was it then to ask the question!

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: You must not be so quick.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Tis long of you that spur me with such questions.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Your wits too hot, it speeds too fast, twill tire.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Not till it leave the rider in the mire.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: What time o day

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: The hour that fools should ask.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Now fair befall your mask!

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Fair fall the face it covers!

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: And send you many lovers!

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Amen, so you be none.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Nay, then will I be gone.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Madam, your father here doth intimate The payment of a hundred thousand crowns Being but the one half of an entire sum Disbursed by my father in his wars. But say that he or we, as neither have, Received that sum, yet there remains unpaid A hundred thousand more in surety of the which, One part of Aquitaine is bound to us, Although not valued to the moneys worth. If then the king your father will restore But that one half which is unsatisfied, We will give up our right in Aquitaine, And hold fair friendship with his majesty. But that, it seems, he little purposeth, For here he doth demand to have repaid A hundred thousand crowns and not demands, On payment of a hundred thousand crowns, To have his title live in Aquitaine Which we much rather had depart withal And have the money by our father lent Than Aquitaine so gelded as it is. Dear Princess, were not his requests so far From reasons yielding, your fair self should make A yielding gainst some reason in my breast And go well satisfied to France again.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: You do the king my father too much wrong And wrong the reputation of your name, In so unseeming to confess receipt Of that which hath so faithfully been paid.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: I do protest I never heard of it And if you prove it, Ill repay it back Or yield up Aquitaine.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: We arrest your word. Boyet, you can produce acquittances For such a sum from special officers Of Charles his father.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Satisfy me so.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: So please your grace, the packet is not come Where that and other specialties are bound: Tomorrow you shall have a sight of them.

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: It shall suffice me: at which interview All liberal reason I will yield unto. Meantime receive such welcome at my hand As honour without breach of honour may Make tender of to thy true worthiness: You may not come, fair princess, in my gates But here without you shall be so received As you shall deem yourself lodged in my heart, Though so denied fair harbour in my house. Your own good thoughts excuse me, and farewell: Tomorrow shall we visit you again.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Sweet health and fair desires consort your grace!

lines.speaker: ferdinand
lines.text: Thy own wish wish I thee in every place!
Exit

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Lady, I will commend you to mine own heart.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Pray you, do my commendations I would be glad to see it.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: I would you heard it groan.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Is the fool sick

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Sick at the heart.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Alack, let it blood.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Would that do it good

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: My physic says ay.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Will you prickt with your eye

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: No point, with my knife.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Now, God save thy life!

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: And yours from long living!

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: I cannot stay thanksgiving.
Retiring

lines.speaker: dumain
lines.text: Sir, I pray you, a word: what lady is that same

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: The heir of Alencon, Katharine her name.

lines.speaker: dumain
lines.text: A gallant lady. Monsieur, fare you well.
Exit

lines.speaker: longaville
lines.text: I beseech you a word: what is she in the white

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: A woman sometimes, an you saw her in the light.

lines.speaker: longaville
lines.text: Perchance light in the light. I desire her name.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: She hath but one for herself to desire that were a shame.

lines.speaker: longaville
lines.text: Pray you, sir, whose daughter

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Her mothers, I have heard.

lines.speaker: longaville
lines.text: Gods blessing on your beard!

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Good sir, be not offended. She is an heir of Falconbridge.

lines.speaker: longaville
lines.text: Nay, my choler is ended. She is a most sweet lady.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Not unlike, sir, that may be.
Exit LONGAVILLE

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Whats her name in the cap

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Rosaline, by good hap.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: Is she wedded or no

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: To her will, sir, or so.

lines.speaker: biron
lines.text: You are welcome, sir: adieu.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Farewell to me, sir, and welcome to you.
Exit BIRON

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: That last is Biron, the merry madcap lord: Not a word with him but a jest.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: And every jest but a word.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: It was well done of you to take him at his word.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: I was as willing to grapple as he was to board.

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: Two hot sheeps, marry.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: And wherefore not ships No sheep, sweet lamb, unless we feed on your lips.

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: You sheep, and I pasture: shall that finish the jest

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: So you grant pasture for me.
Offering to kiss her

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: Not so, gentle beast: My lips are no common, though several they be.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Belonging to whom

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: To my fortunes and me.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Good wits will be jangling but, gentles, agree: This civil war of wits were much better used On Navarre and his bookmen for here tis abused.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: If my observation, which very seldom lies, By the hearts still rhetoric disclosed with eyes, Deceive me not now, Navarre is infected.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: With what

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: With that which we lovers entitle affected.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Your reason

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Why, all his behaviors did make their retire To the court of his eye, peeping thorough desire: His heart, like an agate, with your print impressd, Proud with his form, in his eye pride expressd: His tongue, all impatient to speak and not see, Did stumble with haste in his eyesight to be All senses to that sense did make their repair, To feel only looking on fairest of fair: Methought all his senses were lockd in his eye, As jewels in crystal for some prince to buy Who, tendering their own worth from where they were glassd, Did point you to buy them, along as you passd: His faces own margent did quote such amazes That all eyes saw his eyes enchanted with gazes. Ill give you Aquitaine and all that is his, An you give him for my sake but one loving kiss.

lines.speaker: princess
lines.text: Come to our pavilion: Boyet is disposed.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: But to speak that in words which his eye hath disclosed. I only have made a mouth of his eye, By adding a tongue which I know will not lie.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Thou art an old lovemonger and speakest skilfully.

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: He is Cupids grandfather and learns news of him.

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Then was Venus like her mother, for her father is but grim.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: Do you hear, my mad wenches

lines.speaker: maria
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: What then, do you see

lines.speaker: rosaline
lines.text: Ay, our way to be gone.

lines.speaker: boyet
lines.text: You are too hard for me. LOVES LABOURS LOST DON
Exeunt
